dk.JSF_Hero_vs_Monster.main

Class GameDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.JSF_Hero_vs_Monster.main.GameDatabase

  • public class GameDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    GameDatabase - Used for the communication with an SQLite database. SQL injection avoidance is to be done outside this class.
    Version:
    2.0 26/02-2015.
    Author:
    Simon Jon Pedersen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection databaseConnection
      This is used for the database connection.

      This is used the database statements.
      private boolean heroExists
      Booleans that are used for preventing duplicate values in the database.
      private boolean mapExists
      Booleans that are used for preventing duplicate values in the database.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameDatabase

        public GameDatabase()

    • Method Detail

      • connectToDatabase

        private java.lang.String connectToDatabase()
        Registers the JDBC driver and creates a connections to the database. If no database is found, then a new database will be created. A result in the form of string will also be returned.

      • createTables

        public java.lang.String createTables()
        Creates the tables needed in the database. If the database already have the tables created then this action will not succeed. A result in the form of string will also be returned.

      • getMap

        public Map getMap(java.lang.String heroName)
        Return a map if it is found in the database. If a map is not found in the database then a null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        heroName - - This should be the name of the hero of context.

      • setMap

        public java.lang.String setMap(java.lang.String mapDirectory,
                               java.lang.String mapFileName,
                               java.lang.String heroName)
        Save or update a maps directory and its file name to the database.
        Parameters:
        mapDirectory - - This should be the string that represents the maps directory.
        mapFileName - - This should be the name that represents the maps file name.
        heroName - - This should be the name of the hero of context.

      • getHero

        public Hero getHero(java.lang.String name)
        Return a hero if it is found in the database. If a hero is not found in the database then a null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        name - - This should be the name of the hero that should be found and returned.

      • setHero

        public java.lang.String setHero(Hero hero)
        Save or update a hero to the database.
        Parameters:
        hero - - This should be the hero that should be saved or updated to the database.
